law.text: A person that is licensed or regulated by a unit in the Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation listed in § 2-108 of the Business Regulation Article may not refuse, withhold from, or deny any person any of the accommodations, advantages, facilities, privileges, sales, or services of the licensed or regulated person or discriminate against any person because of the person's race, sex, creed, color, national origin, marital status, sexual orientation, age, or disability.
